result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Shawhan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Shawhan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $568.00  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Cafferty acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $250 fine plus costs, 30 DTP or civil judgment.
With Atty Cafferty the time of the PLEAS on 6/20/16 is changed from 8:15am to 8:45am.
Per ADA Phan the case has resolved.  The jury selection on 6/20/16 is changed to a PLEAS at 8:15.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Cafferty.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

With ADA Phan and Shelley/Atty Cafferty the STC of 6/2/16 at 9:30am is rescheduled, at the State's request as the victim was to speak with the State today but the attorney for the victim could not be present; reset to 6/13/16 at 1:15pm.
With ADA Phan and Shelley/Atty Cafferty the STC of 5/11/16 at 10am is rescheduled, as the State has an appointment to meet w/the victim next week; reset to 6/2/16 at 9:30am.

Judge Barbara A. Kluka, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Phan states they are in process of trying to resolve the case, needs to meet w/victim.  Atty Cafferty agrees but requests a new trial date be set also.  STC continued to 5/11/16 at 10am and JS on 6/20/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Shelley/Atty Cafferty and by agreement of ADA Phan the time of the STC on 4/18/16 is changed from 8:30am to 1:15pm.
Per e-mail from ADA Phan the court is in agreement to change the JS of 4/18/16 at 8:30am to a STC as the alleged victim is not available for a trial that week.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

With Atty Cafferty the JSH of 1/28/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as case remains unresolved, reset to 3/31/16 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  JSH set for 1/28/16 at 1:15pm and JS 4/18/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Cafferty states he is still investigating.  FPT continued to 12/16/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Cafferty states discovery is not complete.  FPT continued to 11/4/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Richard J Shawhan, appeared with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Attorney Jennifer Ann Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:45 am.
